title: TTU rides Toppin gem to upset of No. 1 Arizona

content: Slamming Harshawardhan Sapkal, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said the remarks, ‚Äòcomparing Tipu Sultan with Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj‚Äô, were deplorable

content: The petition submits that Section 44(3) of the Digital Personal Data Protection (DPDP) Act of 2023 has amended the RTI Act to facilitate public authorities to refuse information on the ground that the details sought are of a ‚Äúpersonal‚Äù nature.

content: People in Kerala fears that yet another victory for the CPI(M) will create a Bengal-like situation in the State, says the AICC general secretary

content: The campaign will be rolled out across Kerala Tourism‚Äôs official digital platforms and supported by a dedicated microsite

content: Crackdown follows audit of Rajasthan Government Health Scheme for State employees, pensioners; FIRs registered against a nursing home generating fake claims and a diagnostic centre forging doctors‚Äô signatures

content: He also lauded Congress party workers for their tireless efforts and commitment to the party‚Äôs victory

content: Deputy Chief Minister seeks to know whether the BJP and the Janata Dal governments have given any such pro-people programmes

title: Kanpur Lamborghini crash: No need to question tobacco baron's son Shivam Mishra anymore, says IO
content: Police investigating a Lamborghini crash in Kanpur stated no further interrogation of accused Shivam Kumar Mishra is needed, as all required questioning was completed at his arrest. Mishra, son of a local businessman, was granted bail hours after his arrest, with the court directing his cooperation in the ongoing investigation.

title: 15-year relationship, one WhatsApp text: What led to Noida‚Äôs Valentine‚Äôs Day car murder
content: A man and woman were found dead with gunshot wounds in a locked car in Noida, with police initially suggesting suicide due to a pistol found in the man's hand. However, the man's family alleges murder due to caste-related threats, while the woman's family claims past harassment and recent marital arrangements due to caste differences.

title: Pakistan-linked ‚Äòdeath squads‚Äô accused as seven go missing in Balochistan
content: Recent disappearances in Balochistan, including at least seven individuals in Panjgur and Karachi, are linked to Pakistan's security apparatus. Residents reported raids and detentions, with families of those taken, like Zulfiqar and Zakir Noor, receiving no information, raising fears of secret confinement.

title: 'If the opposition doesn't allow the House to function, we will go for the guillotine': Rijiju
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju announced that the no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will be debated and voted on March 9. The second part of the Budget session, starting the same day, is expected to be "interesting" with crucial legislation. Rijiju warned that continued opposition protests could be detrimental to them and suggested potential cracks in opposition unity.

title: 'It's 'wrong'‚ÄîHarbhajan blasts Amir for his Abhishek Sharma remarks
content: Harbhajan Singh defended Abhishek Sharma after Mohammad Amir called him a ‚Äúslogger‚Äù ahead of the India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup clash. Harbhajan said Abhishek is a skilled and determined batsman with a full range of shots, not someone who blindly hits the ball. He criticised critics for judging without facing him and urged Abhishek to prove himself with a big innings for India.

title: IBM takes U-turn: CEO wanted AI to replace 7.8k jobs, now HR hiring 3x more
content: IBM is set to triple entry-level hiring in 2026, a significant shift from its 2023 stance on AI replacing jobs.  These roles are being redefined, with junior developers focusing more on customer interaction and less on routine coding. This move aims to prevent future talent shortages and acknowledges AI's role in reshaping, not eliminating, work.

title: Indian-origin student found dead in US: Friend says he 'stopped caring about life'
content: A 22-year-old Indian postgraduate student, Saketh Sreenivasaiah, from the University of California, Berkeley, has been found dead. His body was recovered from Lake Anza by authorities after a days-long search. The Indian Consulate in San Francisco confirmed the recovery and is providing support to his family.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel reveals what developers company will never hire
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Raising children in India vs US: American woman shares 6 differences she experienced
content: An American mother raising her daughters in India shares relatable social media comparisons of parenting styles.  Her viral reel highlights differences in sleeping arrangements, baby carrying, feeding, bedtime routines, discipline, and even milk preparation.  These everyday contrasts reveal how cultural values shape childhood, emphasizing that each approach expresses care in its own unique way.

title: 'White-collar' terror probe: Doctors formed 'Ansar Interim' to carry out attacks
content: A new terror outfit, 'Ansar Interim,' formed by radicalised doctors, has been exposed by J&K Police. The group, allegedly linked to Al-Qaeda, planned subversive activities, including IED attacks. Investigations revealed procurement of explosive materials and attempts to recruit members, with a key operative planning a VBIED blast.

title: Saudi Premium Residency for exceptional talent: Salary requirements and eligibility explained
content: Saudi Arabia's Exceptional Talent Premium Residency now welcomes more entities, but strict salary requirements remain. Researchers need SR14,000 monthly, while scientific/healthcare pros require SR35,000. Top executives must earn SR80,000. This selective program targets experienced professionals and leaders, offering five-year renewable residency with family benefits and property ownership.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Kylie Young grabs attention at WM Phoenix Open in summer frock
content: Jack Bech‚Äôs girlfriend Kylie Young used the WM Phoenix Open to quietly own the offseason, sharing sundress and golf-day looks that stood out while the Las Vegas Raiders regroup from a 3-14 year. From Phoenix to Aspen and Raiders game days, her Instagram keeps building a separate highlight reel around the rookie wide receiver.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens‚Äô use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: Sooryavanshi not to appear for Class 10 board exams - here's why
content: India‚Äôs 14-year-old cricket prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi will skip his CBSE Class 10 board exams due to a busy cricket schedule. Despite completing formalities, his family and school decided he wasn‚Äôt prepared. The U19 World Cup star has broken multiple records but can‚Äôt play for India‚Äôs senior team yet due to age rules. Once he turns 15 in 2026, a senior debut is expected.

title: Ramadan working hours in UAE: Philippine embassy in Abu Dhabi announces revised timings
content: The Philippine Embassy in Abu Dhabi and Consulate General in Dubai have announced revised, shorter working hours for Ramadan 2026, from February 19th. These adjustments aim to accommodate fasting practices and ensure efficient service delivery for the large Filipino community in the UAE. Residents are urged to book appointments early and rely on official advisories for updated information.

title: China's secret nuclear expansion: New warhead facilities detected in Sichuan mountains
content: Satellite imagery reveals significant expansion and upgrades at China's nuclear weapons facilities in Sichuan Province, including new bunkers and a plutonium pit production site. This modernization effort, accelerating since 2019, aims to bolster China's superpower status and potentially deter US intervention in future crises, particularly concerning Taiwan.

title: Madras HC judge recuses self over allegation lawyer took Rs 50 lakh to bribe him
content: A Madras High Court judge recused himself from a CBI case after an allegation surfaced that a senior advocate took ‚Çπ50 lakh from a client for a favorable order. The judge referred the matter to the vigilance cell, citing the seriousness of the representation received from the All India Lawyers' Association for Justice.

title: 'I want rain': Ex-Pakistan player gives shocking IND vs PAK verdict
content: Rain threatens the India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match in Colombo, with forecasts predicting heavy showers and storms. Former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali shocked fans by saying he wants rain. A minimum of five overs per side is needed for a result; otherwise, the match will be abandoned and both teams get one point, likely helping both qualify for the next round.

title: G20-like security setup for AI summit in Delhi; bomb squads, 500 CCTVs to guard venue
content: In preparation for the AI Impact Summit in Delhi, a comprehensive security operation is in full effect, incorporating cutting-edge anti-drone technology and an extensive network of over 500 high-definition CCTV cameras. With 5,000 traffic officers deployed, each hotel housing VIPs will be guarded by a dedicated team of 100 personnel.

title: West Bengal voter list may shrink by 68 lakh from 2024 Lok Sabha polls
content: Bengal's voter count is set to decrease by approximately 68 lakh, a significant 9% drop from the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Following a special revision, over 58 lakh absent, shifted, or deceased voters were initially removed. Further exclusions are expected due to unaddressed discrepancies and non-appearances for hearings, potentially impacting the final electoral roll.

title: 'Time to end Islamic republic': Reza Pahlavi urges Trump to help Iranian people
content: Reza Pahlavi, son of Iran's last shah, has appealed to US President Donald Trump. He called for an end to the Islamic republic, stating it is the demand of the Iranian people. Pahlavi asked Trump to help Iranians, referencing the President's earlier remarks about change in Iran. Trump has increased military pressure on the Islamic republic.

title: Mumbai metro mishap: 5 arrested, Rs 6 crore fine imposed ‚Äî what triggered the parapet failure?
content: Five individuals, including project directors and managers from RAJV-Milan Infra and DB-Hill-LBG consortium, were arrested after a Metro Line 4 parapet segment collapsed, killing one and injuring three. MMRDA imposed penalties on contractors and consultants, while politicians highlighted previous violations and safety concerns. An inquiry committee has been formed to investigate the incident.

title: Vijay and Rashmika wedding: Big south stars on guest list
content: Wedding bells are ringing for Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna, with reports suggesting an intimate February 26th ceremony in Udaipur. A grand Hyderabad reception is planned for March 4th, expecting a star-studded guest list. The couple reportedly rejected a massive Rs 60 crore streaming offer for their wedding, prioritizing privacy for the event.

title: Diving turns dangerous: Oman issues warning after man swims with killer whale
content: Oman's Environment Authority has issued a stern warning against diving near orcas following a viral video of a man swimming close to the powerful marine predators. The advisory emphasises the unpredictable nature and immense strength of these wild animals, stressing that such close encounters pose serious risks to both human lives and wildlife wellbeing.

title: Watch: Photos framed, prayers offered at Kanpur temple before IND vs PAK match
content: Fans in Kanpur prayed for India‚Äôs victory ahead of the India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match in Colombo. India and Pakistan have started the tournament strongly, with India dominating past T20 World Cup meetings and having a strong record at the venue. The match is scheduled for Sunday at 7 PM IST, but rain could affect play, with forecasts predicting showers during the day.

title: Did Jeffrey Epstein use Nobel glam to entice global elites?
content: Jeffrey Epstein leveraged his connections with Thorbjorn Jagland, former head of the Nobel Peace Prize committee, to impress influential figures like Bill Gates and Richard Branson.  Files reveal Epstein frequently mentioned Jagland's visits, sparking interest among elites.  Jagland now faces corruption charges in Norway following the document release.

title: Bangladesh invites 13 nations, including India, to BNP govt swearing-in; who‚Äôs on the list
content: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party (BNP), led by Tarique Rahman, is set to form a new government following a landslide victory in the 2026 general election. Leaders from 13 countries have been invited to the swearing-in ceremony, signaling the party's inclusive foreign policy. The BNP expressed gratitude for PM Modi's congratulatory message and looks forward to constructive engagement with India.

title: Horrific accident in Bengaluru: 5 dead as speeding car collides head-on with bus
content: A tragic road accident near Jindal on Tumakuru Road claimed five lives late Saturday night when a speeding car crashed into a divider, veered into oncoming traffic, and collided head-on with a KSRTC bus. Four car occupants died instantly, and the critically injured driver later succumbed. The bus was carrying 42 passengers, with a few sustaining minor injuries.

title: 'Jana Nayagan': No date before April 2026 for Vijay's film
content: Vijay's final film, 'Jana Nayagan,' faces further delays, now pushed past April 30, 2026, according to Canadian distributor York Cinemas. This latest setback follows earlier certification issues. Meanwhile, Vijay's 2016 hit 'Theri' will now re-release on February 20, offering fans a consolation.

title: Barack Obama says aliens are 'real', but rules out Area 51 conspiracy
content: Former US President Barack Obama has publicly stated his belief in the existence of aliens, though he admits he has no concrete evidence or knowledge of their whereabouts. He dismissed theories about Area 51, emphasizing that no such secrets are hidden from the President.

title: Hardik Pandya is the Atum of Indian cricket: 'Hope we remember what he's done on field'
content: Hardik Pandya‚Äôs journey mirrors self-creation ‚Äî rising from obscurity to become India‚Äôs white-ball MVP while battling scrutiny, injuries and perception. Backed by mentors like Kieron Pollard, he has turned chaos into control, proving his resilience repeatedly. Beyond the flash lies a cricketer defined by reinvention and an unrelenting will to succeed.

title: Getting first house in UAE? 5 real estate trends home owners should focus on
content: UAE's property market is seeing a surge in first-time homebuyers in 2026, driven by government support and a shift towards long-term value. Buyers now prioritise build quality, practical design and community infrastructure over speculation. Affordability and tech-driven mortgage solutions are making ownership more accessible, fostering a generation committed to homeownership as a lifestyle choice.

title: What‚Äôs in a name, if we can‚Äôt make it ‚Äòours‚Äô? Indians and their delicious dialect of food
content: A viral video of a boy mispronouncing 'croissant' as 'prashant' sparked a humorous trend, with Britannia even renaming its product. This highlights a common phenomenon in India where foreign food names are often adapted, reflecting a unique way of embracing new cuisines. Similarly, regional Indian dishes also face pronunciation variations, showcasing a blend of linguistic adaptation and cultural engagement.

title: T20 WC: When, where and how to watch IND vs PAK on TV and online?
content: The India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup 2026 match will be played on Sunday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Both teams started strongly, with India dominating early and Pakistan recovering well. India has historically dominated Pakistan in T20 World Cups and has a strong record at this venue. Rain may affect the game. The match starts at 7 PM IST and will be broadcast on Star Sports and streamed on JioHotstar.

title: ‚ÄòBurning eyes, breathing trouble‚Äô: Yogi Adityanath likens Delhi‚Äôs air to ‚Äògas chamber‚Äô
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed concern over Delhi's poor air quality, likening it to a gas chamber and a result of environmental neglect. He contrasted this with Gorakhpur's clean atmosphere, highlighting a proposed forestry university as a long-term solution to environmental challenges and public health issues.

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: the WNBA and players' association continue negotiating a new collective bargaining agreement . most players not under rookie contracts are free agents, plus there are two expansion teams that don't have any players yet . we are projecting draft selections without important context about the players they will be joining .

title: Premier League superlatives: The 25 best and worst players at different skills
content: ESPN's Nedum Onuoha thinks he should make the squad . we are back for Year 2 . i'm going to answer all of those questions down below . who is the fastest runner? Who is the most reliable goalkeeper? who never makes mistakes?

title: USA defeats Denmark 6-3: Top moments from Olympic men's hockey
content: Emily Kaplan talks with Noah Hanifin, Matt Boldy and Jake Guentzel following the U.S men's hockey team's 6-3 win over Denmark. (0:54) After a commanding  5-1 win  over Latvia, the United States men's hockey team was back in action for Game 2 of the preliminary round in the 2026 Olympics. Saturday's game was against Denmark, which lost 3-1 to Germany in its first game. The United States won, 6-3. The U.S. now sits atop Group C, with six points. The top team from each group gets a bye into the quarterfinal round of the tournament, which begins Wednesday. Center  Brock Nelson  led the U.S. in scoring after one game, with two goals, while forwards  Jack Eichel ,  Jack Hughes ,  Matthew Tkachuk  and defenseman  Quinn Hughes  all had two assists. Forwards  Auston Matthews ,  Tage Thompson  and  Brady Tkachuk  were the other goal scorers in the opening contest. More:  Men's hockey megapreview  |  Lapsed fan's guide  |  Player rankings

title: 11 draft prospects with a true first-round grade
content: the average draft class has roughly 15 players who are deemed "first-round talents" a player would have been a first-rounder in each of the past five classes . the 2026 class actually has fewer players at the moment .

title: How UCLA's softball star decided to join the basketball program
content: MEGAN GRANT has a career .727 slugging percentage, .978 fielding percentage and earned the Big Ten single-season record for home runs with 26 in 2025 . the senior softball star will have weight training, class and softball practice before putting on her jersey .

content: the game was much more dramatic than many had predicted, but the result was a 6-3 win for the united states over Denmark . team USA trailed 2-1 after the first period, before roaring back to score three in the second . the netminder allowed three goals on just 12 shots, one being a center-ice strike by rugged Danish league defender Nick Jensen .

content: a group of fans are angry at baseball . they are inside of group chats that talk about how much money the Los Angeles Dodgers are spending . owners blame the system that governs Major League Baseball . a salary cap would juiper the game, owners say .
